For each positive integer $ m > 1$, let $ P(m)$ denote the greatest prime factor of $ m$. For how many positive integers $ n$ is it true that both $ P(n) = \sqrt{n}$ and $ P(n + 48) = \sqrt{n + 48}$?\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ 0\qquad 
\textbf{(B)}\ 1\qquad 
\textbf{(C)}\ 3\qquad 
\textbf{(D)}\ 4\qquad 
\textbf{(E)}\ 5$
